Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is too heavy-handed and resembles a totalitarian approach rather than a democratic one.
The definition of 'harm' is subjective and should not be left to the judgment of an anonymous member of ACMA.
There is a lack of provision for scrutiny or checks on decisions made by ACMA.
Digital platforms may become overly cautious and restrict content that does not align with government agendas due to fear of fines.
The legislation curtails freedoms and treats citizens as incapable of making their own decisions.
Notable Quotes: The proposed means of bringing this about is far too heavy handed, and sounds more like a totalitarian, controlling autocracy than a true democracy.
The definition of 'harm' is very subjective, and this should not be left to the judgment of some anonymous member of the ACMA to decide.
We should have the freedom to make up our own minds; we may not always make the right decisions, but we should have the freedom to do so!
